JUDGES: Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings for damages against ORG in ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the claim as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the judgment was upheld by ORG and ORG of GPE , respectively .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant also instituted proceedings against her former employer , the local police department , seeking recovery of some retirement - related and other payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found against her .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Dnipropetrovsk Regional Court of Appeal upheld the judgment . It stated in the operative part that the applicant had the right to challenge the decision before ORG within DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed in cassation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG declined jurisdiction to consider her appeal in cassation on the ground that the case was of a “ civil ” rather than an “ administrative ” nature and therefore ORG was the correct court of cassation .

CARDINAL . The applicant resubmitted her appeal in cassation to ORG . On DATE the latter , referring to LAW , declined jurisdiction asserting that , in fact , ORG was the appropriate forum for the case .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and documents of ORG are quoted in the judgment in PERSON and GPE v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
